conclusion: Determine the speed of the block from point A to B and the ratio of supporting force to gravitational force at point B.
Block slides from point A to B on a circular track with radius 0.8 m, starting from rest.
Distance between points A and B is 0.2 m.
Speed of the block can be calculated using the kinematic equation v = sqrt(2as).
Acceleration a can be calculated using a = v^2/r.
Calculate acceleration a = (0.2 m)^2 / 0.8 m = 0.05 m/s^2.
Substitute a and s into the kinematic equation to find v.
